faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to your questions about period pain management

q1.question: How does PeriodHub help me manage period pain?
q1.answer: PeriodHub provides smart tracking, professional assessment, and evidence-based medical guides to help you scientifically manage period pain symptoms.

q2.question: Is my data secure?
q2.answer: We use the highest level of data encryption and privacy protection measures to ensure your personal information is secure.

q3.question: Are the medical guides on the platform reliable?
q3.answer: All medical guides are based on evidence-based medicine and reviewed by professional medical teams to ensure scientific accuracy.

q4.question: How can I get personalized recommendations?
q4.answer: Through symptom assessment and pain tracking, our AI system will provide you with personalized health recommendations.

q5.question: Is the platform free?
q5.answer: Basic features are completely free, with premium features available as paid options to ensure service sustainability.

q6.question: When should I see a doctor?
q6.answer: If period pain seriously affects your life or you experience abnormal symptoms, we recommend consulting a professional doctor promptly.

q7.question: How do I start using the platform?
q7.answer: After registering an account, complete the basic assessment to start using all features.

stressManagement.title: Stress Management

stressManagement.keywords: stress management,period stress,menstrual health,stress relief,relaxation techniques,workplace stress,women health
stressManagement.subtitle: Help you effectively manage period-related stress and anxiety

stressLevels.lowDesc: Low stress level, maintaining good condition
stressLevels.moderateDesc: Moderate stress, requires attention and regulation
stressLevels.highDesc: High stress, recommend taking relief measures

resources.title: Resource Recommendations
resources.subtitle: More resources to help you manage stress

common.medicalDisclaimer: This website content is for informational and educational purposes only and is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Please consult a healthcare professional for any health concerns.

neuroendocrine.title: Neuroendocrine Cascade
neuroendocrine.subtitle: Understanding how stress affects menstruation through complex physiological mechanisms

acute.title: Acute Stress Response
acute.description: Short-term stress activates HPA axis, releases cortisol, usually recovers quickly

chronic.title: Chronic Stress Impact
chronic.description: Long-term stress causes persistent cortisol elevation, may severely affect menstrual cycle

neuroendocrine.keyInsightDescription: Understanding these mechanisms helps better manage stress impact on menstruation

evolutionary.title: Evolutionary Biology Perspective
evolutionary.subtitle: Why does stress affect menstruation? The ancient wisdom of the body
evolutionary.mainDescription: Stress effects on menstruation are actually protective mechanisms
evolutionary.storyContent: When our ancestors faced life threats, the body would automatically judge that it's not a good time for reproduction and pause ovulation and menstruation.
evolutionary.modernContent: Work stress, relationship issues and other psychological pressures are misinterpreted by the body as survival threats, continuously activating ancient systems.
evolutionary.realization1: Your body's response is not a malfunction
evolutionary.realization2: It's executing an ancient protection program
evolutionary.realization3: Understanding this can reduce self-blame and anxiety
evolutionary.practicalDescription: When you feel stress affecting your menstruation, try telling yourself:
evolutionary.selfTalk: My body is protecting me, this is a normal physiological response. Now I need to tell it: the crisis is over, you can relax.

action1.title: Cognitive Reframing
action1.description: View stress response as protection rather than problem

action2.title: Relaxation Training
action2.description: Tell your body the crisis is over through relaxation techniques

detail1.title: Survival Advantage
detail1.content: This mechanism helped our ancestors survive in crises

detail2.title: Modern Adaptation
detail2.content: Need to learn to distinguish real threats from psychological stress

detail3.title: Self-Compassion
detail3.content: Maintain understanding and compassion for body's responses

comparison.title: Acute vs Chronic Stress
comparison.subtitle: Understanding characteristics and impacts of different stress types
comparison.keyTakeawayContent: Acute stress is usually manageable, chronic stress requires systematic intervention.

action1.title: Acute Stress Management
action1.description: Use immediate relief techniques like deep breathing and short breaks

action2.title: Chronic Stress Intervention
action2.description: Requires long-term strategies and possibly professional help

assessment.title: Stress Assessment
assessment.subtitle: Understand your stress condition through scientific assessment
assessment.instructionsDetail: Please answer the following questions honestly based on your actual situation. This will help us provide you with personalized stress management recommendations.

q1.question: Have you frequently felt anxious or tense recently?

q3.question: Do you often feel tired or lack energy?

q4.question: Do you easily feel irritable or angry?

q5.question: Do you often worry about period-related issues?

personalized.title: Personalized Recommendations
personalized.description: Provide customized stress management strategies based on your answers

tracking.title: Progress Tracking
tracking.description: Record your stress management progress and improvements

insights.title: Deep Insights
insights.description: Understand how stress affects your menstruation and overall health

techniques.title: Relaxation Techniques
techniques.subtitle: Scientific relaxation methods to help you relieve stress

breathing.title: Breathing Exercise
breathing.description: Relax body and mind through breathing regulation
breathing.instructionsDetail: Follow audio guidance for deep breathing exercises, practice for 5-10 minutes each time.

benefits.benefit2: Lower heart rate and blood pressure

meditation.title: Meditation Practice
meditation.instructionsDetail: Follow guided audio for meditation practice, start with 5 minutes and gradually extend.

exercise.title: Light Exercise
exercise.description: Gentle exercises suitable for menstrual periods
exercise.instructionsDetail: Choose gentle exercises suitable for menstrual periods, such as yoga, walking or stretching.

music.title: Music Therapy
music.instructionsDetail: Choose soothing music, close your eyes and listen for 10-15 minutes.

timing.title: Best Timing
timing.tip1: Practice after waking up or before bed
timing.tip3: Increase practice frequency one week before period

precautions.title: Precautions
precautions.tip1: Choose a quiet and comfortable environment
precautions.tip4: Stop immediately if you feel unwell

addEntry.title: Add Entry
addEntry.subtitle: Record your stress condition and techniques used today

insights.title: Deep Insights
insights.description: Understand your stress patterns and triggers

trends.title: Trend Analysis
trends.description: Discover areas for improvement and attention

quantifiedImpact.title: Quantified Impact Data
quantifiedImpact.subtitle: Stress impact data based on scientific research

details.title: Detailed Description
details.anxiety: Anxiety symptoms significantly worsen under high stress, affecting daily life and work performance.
details.depression: Depression is more likely to occur in high-stress environments and needs timely attention.
details.irritability: Irritability and mood swings are most obvious under high stress, affecting relationships.

insight1.title: Stress Accumulation Effect
insight1.description: Long-term stress has greater impact on menstruation than short-term stress

insight2.title: Individual Differences
insight2.description: Everyone has different sensitivity to stress

insight3.title: Reversibility
insight3.description: Most stress effects can recover after stress relief

insight4.title: Importance of Prevention
insight4.description: Early stress management is more effective than later treatment

immediate.title: Immediate Action
immediate.description: Identify stress sources and take relief measures

longterm.title: Long-term Strategy
longterm.description: Establish a continuous stress management system

painPatterns.title: Identify Your Pain Patterns
painPatterns.subtitle: Every woman's pain pattern is unique, but usually follows certain rules. Through detailed observation and recording, you can identify your own pain pattern and develop more effective prevention and management strategies.

menstrualFocused.title: Menstrual Concentrated Type (70%)
characteristics: Pain concentrated 1-2 days before and 1-2 days during menstruation
Pain significantly reduced or disappeared after the 3rd day
Pain intensity peaks on the 1st day

wholePeriodPersistent.title: Whole Period Persistent Type (20%)
characteristics: Lasts throughout the entire menstrual period

premenstrualProminent.title: Pre-menstrual Prominent Type (8%)
characteristics: Pain most severe 1-3 days before menstruation

irregularFluctuation.title: Irregular Fluctuation Type (2%)
characteristics: No clear pattern in pain timing
May be related to stress, lifestyle, and other factors

recordingImportance.title: Importance of Pain Records
recordingImportance.description: Keeping a detailed pain diary is the most effective way to understand personal patterns. By recording for 3-6 consecutive months, you will be able to clearly see your pain patterns.

analysisDimensions.title: Analysis Dimensions
items: Which day of the menstrual cycle is the pain most severe

influencingFactors.title: Factors Affecting Individual Cycle Patterns
influencingFactors.description: Every woman's menstrual cycle and pain pattern are influenced by multiple factors. Understanding these factors helps to better predict and manage pain.

ageAndDevelopment.title: Age and Developmental Stage
items: Adolescence (13-19 years old): Cycles are often irregular, pain may be more severe
Adulthood (20-35 years old): Cycles are generally stable, pain patterns are fixed
After childbirth: Approximately 60% of women experience reduced pain
Perimenopause: Cycles change significantly, pain patterns may change

bodyCharacteristics.title: Body Characteristics
items: Body fat percentage is related to estrogen metabolism
Individual differences in body sensitivity are large
Genetic factors account for a significant proportion

healthStatus.title: Health Status
items: Polycystic ovary syndrome leads to abnormal cycles
Pelvic inflammatory disease affects pain pattern

environmentalImpact.title: Environmental Impact
items: Light changes: Seasonal affective disorder affects hormones
Climate conditions: Atmospheric pressure changes may affect pain perception
Environmental toxins: Chemical substances interfere with hormone balance

socialPsychological.title: Social Psychological Factors
items: Cultural adaptation: Cognitive attitudes towards menstruation
Social support: Understanding level of family and friends
Work environment: Occupational stress and work arrangements

optimizationStrategies.title: Apply Knowledge to Optimize Pain Management
optimizationStrategies.description: After understanding the scientific knowledge of menstrual cycles and pain patterns, we can transform this information into practical strategies to optimize pain management effectiveness.

earlyLutealPhase.title: 1-2 weeks before menstruation (early luteal phase)
items: Start increasing anti-inflammatory food intake (omega-3, turmeric)
Optimize sleep quality, ensure 7-8 hours of rest
Engage in stress management activities (meditation, yoga)

premenstrualDays.title: 3-5 days before menstruation
items: Appropriately reduce caffeine and alcohol intake
Prepare heat therapy equipment and comfortable clothing

peakPainDays.title: Days 1-2 of menstruation (peak pain period)
items: Apply all available relief methods promptly
Maintain hydration, but avoid excessive fluids
Adopt optimal positioning for pain relief
Engage in gentle activities if possible, rest when needed

medicationTiming.title: Medication Timing
items: NSAIDs: Take 1-2 hours before pain starts for best effect
Hormone supplementation: Follow doctor's instructions for optimal absorption
Traditional Chinese medicine: Start conditioning herbs 1-2 weeks in advance

recoveryOptimization.title: Recovery Optimization
items: Progressive activity: Gradually increase activity level as pain subsides
Nutrition recovery: Focus on nutrient replenishment after menstruation
Reflection assessment: Evaluate the effectiveness of this treatment strategy

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
items: Menstrual cycle is a precisely regulated biological rhythm, understanding its mechanism helps in scientific pain management
Prostaglandins are the main cause of menstrual pain, but can be effectively managed through various methods
Everyone's pain pattern is unique, personal patterns can be discovered through detailed recording
Preventive intervention is superior to reactive treatment, timing is the key to success
Comprehensive consideration of physiological, psychological and environmental factors can achieve optimal treatment effects

medicalDisclaimer.title: Medical Disclaimer
